You burst into a room filled with lab equipment - tables full of glassware, monitors, odd instruments, and many feet of tubing and wires. You swing a table around behind you and hear a satisfying crash as the two guards tumble over it.

That buys you enough time to duck into a closet and freeze. The guards go running by your hiding place. You catch your breath at last, but it's not over yet. The guards will be back. You can't just stand there forever.

Then you remember the strange device that got you here in the first place, that translucent green object that you picked up in the caverns after you entered the red door. You snatch it out of your pocket and push at it and squeeze it, but nothing happens.

Suddenly the guards reappear and they see you. There is nowhere to run, but then there is a sudden flash of light. You have managed to trigger the device again. This time the results are different. Reality fragments around you and you find yourself unable to perceive anything correctly. The fragments of reality spin and shift and you become completely disoriented.
13311.title: Transmatter (3)

133111.content:
You black out. When you awaken, you find yourself in a forest. There is a girl with long golden hair, wearing a white dress, sitting a few paces away from you. She is staring at you intently. You are not complaining. She is very beautiful.

She is quiet for a moment, then calls out, "Jack! Here is another one".

A moment later, you hear footsteps, and two young men arrive, one of whom you presume to be Jack. He looks very like the girl in white, so you guess them to be related. The other boy is very tall, with tanned skin and dark eyes. He looks at you suspiciously.

Jack stops before you. "What is your name?" he demands.

"I am Luke", you tell him.

"Where do you hail from?"

"I don't know", you say. "Where am I?"

"You are in Eden's Hull. We must leave here immmediately. We are all in grave danger. We would like you to come with us."


Well?
133111.title: Eden's Hull

choices: A device with a small viewscreen.
14.content: The table contains several items. You pick up one to examine it more closely.
14.title: The Table

141.content: You pick up the book bound in leather and open it. It is a handwritten journal. When you open it, a loose page falls out.
141.title: The Book Bound in Leather

1411.content:
You begin to read...

"In the beginning, it was just me and her, our little paradise. We lived out our days unaffected by anything except our love for each other. I would meet her every morning and we would ride through the park on the beautiful white horses her father had given her as a birthday gift. Afterwards, we would walk up the lonely hill that was near her home, and stay there for hours, sometimes not even talking, but just sitting there together. Nobody existed except for the two of us. And then it all changed..."

You turn the page over, but nothing on the back. You shake the book to see if any more loose pages fall out.
1411.title: Nobody existed except for the two of us...

choices: Take the leather off the book and see what is written
14111.content: It just so happens, another loose page fall's out, the last page of the book. You begin to read it. "Why did this have to happen? Is this the end? Everything so wonderful befallen into chaos." You begin to wonder what is going on. This interests you but all the other pages of the book are blank.
14111.title: The Last Page

141111.content: Removing the leather binding reveals a small mirror set into the cover of the book. You peer into the mirror for the novelty of it, and soon realize that you have traded places with your reflection. Imprisoned within the book, your memories return to you only briefly before they are resigned to your parchment prison mates. Your life has been immortalized in these pages, however it is forever lost to you.
141111.title: Just For the Record

14112.content:
You randomly flip through the pages of the book until a dark stain in the corner of one of the pages catches your eye.

You take a closer look and realize the stain is actually blood. The blood has long since dried and on the page all that is written is:

"You ended it, not me.
Good bye."

You quickly look away and search the room for any person that might be with you, of course there isn't any but you do see more blood.
14112.title: bloodied

1412.content:
On the first page is written in big letters

THE JOURNAL OF HAC MINDTOOL


"Hac Mindtool," you think. "What an odd name." You turn the page and begin reading.


I spawned at the Delta node. I had no memories of previous spawnings, of course, nor was I at first even aware that I was not the only one.

I am writing this journal in hopes that it may help those who spawn after me, to give them the knowledge that I had to learn by trial and error. This is the path that I took. I know it is not the only path, but it is the one that I know.

I discovered a secret panel in the room with three doors. DON'T KICK IT! Don't press the red button. To open the panel you need only jump up and down. When the elevator appeared, I pressed the "down" button.

I found myself in the Fitting Room of Barl the Outfitter. A word of warning: Though he seems friendly enough, he can be a bully at times. But it is essential that you have the proper equipment, so pay attention to what he says.
1412.title: Journal

142.content:
The scroll seems very old. It feels dry and powdery as you unroll the first section. It is a drawing delicately done with ink and brush. It's hard to make out what the drawing depicts because the ink has faded and the scroll is cracked.

After a little study you realize that it is a drawing of a group of naked girls and boys. They seem to be playing some kind of ball game. The girls are on one side, the boys on the other. Between them is what you first take to be a ball, but when you look closer you see that it must be a globe. You can make out continents drawn on it's surface.

You unroll the rest of the scroll. There is lots of writing on the scroll, but not in your language, and only one other drawing.

At first, you can make no sense of the second drawing, until you realize that it is a horse and rider traveling through a landscape of rock.

You put down the scroll.
142.title: The Scroll

1421.content:
The rider holds a flaming sword in a chariot drawn by anything but horses.

The beasts pulling the weight of the seemingly omni-being have scales. Maybe even a reptilian looking goat. You don't know.

Your head starts hurting in the temples on both sides so violently that you drop the scroll and put your palms to the sides of your heads... Then all turns black.
1421.title: Macabre Chariot

143.content:
You pick up the device with a viewscreen. It is small enough to fit in your pocket.

As you examine it, something you do makes the tiny screen light up. There is a girl's face on it. She seems to be looking at you. Then she turns as though she has heard something off to her left. She jumps back from the screen and runs off in the other direction. You only see her whole body for a fraction of a second, but that is long enough to see that she is naked.

You study the screen, but it only shows an empty room now. It's hard to make out the things in her room. They are in the distance and out of focus, but you think that it might be a bed and a table and some pictures on a wall. Then the screen goes blank. You can't figure out how to make it light up again.

You can't get the image of the girl out of your head. She looked like she might be in trouble - like she might be trying to get away from something or somebody.

You turn the viewing device this way and that trying to discover how to make it work again. It starts to make a beeping noise, so you must have turned on something. The beeps begin slowly: beep.......beep.......beep.......beep....... but speed up rapidly to beep, beep, beep, beep, and just when you think you should throw the device down, there is a very loud "crack!" and you are no longer in the room but are standing outdoors. You can hear the echo of the "crack!" repeating over and over as it fades out.
143.title: Viewscreen

1431.content:
The sudden change in location takes your breath away for a moment, but you quickly recover. This is a place of rolling hills and you are standing on the crest of a hill. Nearby is a dirt road that continues on into a distant forest.

You turn around. In that direction the hills become small mountains.

On one of the mountains is a fortress made of stone - a castle. It's so far away that its details are lost in the haze, but it is definitely a castle - there are walls and towers. It seems to grow from a small mountain, as if the lower parts of its walls were carved from the solid rock of the mountain.

In that castle is the girl from the viewscreen. You don't know why you think that, but you feel quite sure of it. You stick the viewing device in your pocket and walk toward the castle.

The sky is a clear blue with white fluffy clouds and a cool breeze feels good on your face. The dirt road is well-marked by horseshoes and wagon wheels.

A rabbit snarls at you and runs across the road.

Rabbits. You are glad that you have remembered that word, but you feel that what you saw was not exactly a rabbit. It was small and furry and hopped, but you don't think that rabbits should have such sharp teeth.
1431.title: The Castle

choices: Try to hide in a wagon
14311.content:
After a few hours walk, you are close enough to the castle to see the entrance. The dirt road leads up to a huge door set solidly in the wall. The door is made of wood reinforced with iron and it is closed.

You hear the noise of a wagon coming down the dirt road behind you. It is just out of site behind the curve of a hill. You jump off the road and hide in the weeds. As the wagon comes by, you see that it is pulled by a strange beast with striped fur and big hooves. The driver is not human.

Your heart skips a beat. Good thing you hid in the weeds. This thing driving the wagon looks very mean. Although it is shaped like a man, it's skin is reptilian with a black and white pattern of swirls and spots. It wears no clothes except for a leather belt that has pouches attached to it.

It's head is quite strange. It has a short snout and a pink tongue that flicks in and out. It's eyes are very near the sides of it's head, but swivel so that it can look straight ahead. It's hands have fingers that are extremely long. It's feet have toes with claws.

The wagon heads up to the castle and stops. The lizard-like creature makes a loud whistling sound. Behind the walls chains rattle and the huge door slowly opens. The wagon goes in and the door is closed.

You sit in the weeds and think. If these lizard creatures are in control of the castle, then you can't just run in and save the girl. You will have to be stealthy and clever.

You think of various ways to get inside. It finally comes down to two possible courses of action.
14311.title: The Wagon

143111.content:
If you could somehow conceal yourself in the cargo of a wagon, then perhaps you could get inside without being seen.

You walk back down the dirt road until you come to a place where the road crosses a stream. There is no bridge, but the stream is shallow enough for the wagons to cross.

It is muddy here and you can see by the tracks that wagon wheels sink into the mud. This is a place where the wagons have to slow down and the driver has to devote his full attention to crossing the stream. In addition, there is a lot of foliage along the stream where you can hide. This place seems perfect. You sit down behind a tree to wait.

It doesn't take long before you hear wagons coming. There are two of them. The lead wagon is small like the other wagon you saw, with a single lizardman driver and one beast pulling it. But the second wagon is much larger. Four beasts pull it. The wagon is covered with canvas. Now, if you can just get inside that cover without being seen...

From your hiding place behind the tree, you hear the lizardmen talking in their language of whistles and hisses. You peak around the tree trunk and see that the first wagon is already across and the second one soon will be. But one of the lizardmen is there at the back of the big wagon, preventing your move.

You silently curse your bad luck, but then when the wagon finally clears the stream, the lizardman runs up to jump on the front of the wagon. You burst from your cover and sprint over to the back of the wagon, lift up the canvas, and scoot inside.

The wagon is filled with sacks of something, maybe vegetables of some kind. The smell is peculiar, like onions and something you can't identify. But at least you are in the wagon and apparently safe. You arrange the bags so that you are hidden. Now, even if anyone looks inside they will not see you.

After a brief time of travel, the wagon stops, and you hear the sound of the gateway into the castle being opened.
143111.title: The Stream

1431111.content:
As soon as you hear the door of the castle closing and know that the wagon is inside, you peek out from under the canvas cover. The wagon crosses a large courtyard, then passes into a narrow alleyway between high walls.

From your vantage point in back, you watch the walls pass by. When an open doorway appears, you jump out of the wagon and quickly slip through it. You pause just inside, listening, looking, all your senses on heightened awareness. You detect no activity, so you continue on into the room, moving quickly and staying alert.

It isn't clear what the room is used for. It contains a table and some wooden chests, but you notice a narrow stairway at the back and climb up to the next floor. This is clearly a store room of some kind and there are plenty of places to hide. You decide this would be as good a rathole as any to settle down in and collect your wits.

You make a slight rearrangement of some broken furniture and wooden boxes filled with crockery. You even find an old blanket that you can use for a bed. Soon you have a nest made. It's not that you plan to live here for long, but you don't know where the girl is or how long it will take to find her, so you want to have a good hiding place. At night you can search for the girl.

You drift off to sleep, waiting for nightfall and darkness. When you wake up, you notice a blue glow in your pocket - the viewscreen! You snatch it out, and there is the girl. She seems to be looking right into your eyes. "Where are you?" she whispers.

You almost drop the viewscreen. "Can you hear me?" you whisper.

"Yes. Are you in the castle?"

"Yes, but I don't know where."

She studies your face. "Have you come to save me?"

"Yes!" you say.

She smiles. "I thought so! What is your name?"

The name thing again! You say the first thing that pops into your mind, "Tom. What's yours?"

"Ariana. Thanks for coming to save me, Tom."

"Why are you here, Ariana? What are all these lizard things?"

"Those are the Tsiuni, Tom. They killed my family. You must save me, okay?"

"Sure!" you whisper. "That's why I'm here. But where are you in the castle?"

"The Old Tower. The Tsiuni have their guard quarters on the ground floor of the Old tower, but there is a secret passage they don't know about. The Old Tower is the one that has tiny square windows. The other towers all have rectangular windows. Can you find it?"

"I think so. What about the secret passage?"

"We'll talk again. I have to go now." And the screen goes blank.

You settle back into your "nest". In a few hours, when most of the castle is asleep, you will make your move.
1431111.title: Inside the Castle

14311111.content:
You wait until well past midnight to make your move. All is silent in the castle. You ease out onto the ledge near your hiding place. There is a guard down below, but he is not looking up. He seems half asleep, leaning on his long spear.

You look around at the towers of the castle and easily spot the Old Tower. If you can get past the guard below, you will be able to reach the base of the tower. Unfortunately, when you jump down to the ground as quietly as you can, it is not quietly enough for a dog sleeping nearby. His barking spurs you into a fast sprint across the courtyard and into a dark alley. You pause, slightly winded, but you hear nothing except the guard hushing the dog.

The stones of the Old Tower are old and cracked, with gaps where weathering has cracked loose chunks of rock. It may be possible to climb the tower. That would leave you exposed to view, although the outside of the tower can only be seen by someone outside the castle grounds and it is unlikely anyone would be there in the rocky hills around the castle.

And what about Ariana's "secret passage"? Maybe that would be the best way to reach her. You pull out the viewscreen, but the little gadget has a dark screen.
14311111.title: Old Tower

143111111.content: you shake the gadget and then you can see something on that screen again
143111111.title: screen

1431111111.content: but where do they guide you?
1431111111.title: signs

144.content:
On the table is a small glass bottle with a cork stopper. The label is handwritten in a fine delicate penmanship. You have to squint to read the tiny letters.

"Just one sip will make you hip. If you sip twice, you'll pay a price. One sip more to make it three and you end your life in misery."

It sounds like powerful medicine. Perhaps it's better not to mess with it. On the other hand, you have always yearned to be hip ever since you visited Uncle Nernie in New York for a week and he took you to a few jazz clubs. "Can you dig it, man?" Uncle Nernie said. "Are you hip to it?" Well, you said you were, but you knew you weren't. And now here is this little bottle promising instant hipness. How can you resist?
144.title: The Magic Potion

1441.content:
You take one sip and set the bottle down.

At first nothing seems different. Then you notice a slight change in your vision. You realize that you are in a room with three doors of different colors.

You look at the little bottle you just sipped from and it has a strange clarity about it, as though it's the prototype bottle from which all the other bottles in the universe were created.

Then you notice that the other objects on the table each have there own unique existence.

You spend several minutes looking at the grain in the leather cover of the book, admiring the way it seems to be a random pattern and yet makes sense if you let your eye trace the ridges and valleys. It's like you are looking at a landscape and you imagine there might be a whole colony of microscopic animals living on the leather. To them the ridges of the pattern are mountains and they can spend days trudging from one side of the book to the other.

When your attention finally leaves the book and goes looking for something else, you think "Wow! How long was I looking at that leather?"

You go to the blue door and open it. It's a straight drop down out there and you immediately feel dizzy. "Wow!" you say. "It's like a hundred miles down!" And you come back in and shut the door.

You try the green door, but it's like a jungle out there. You can hear a lion growl and you jump back inside.

You open the red door into a dark cavern. You stare until your eyes adjust to the dim red light and then you scream. There is a huge monster with a mouthful of teeth coming toward you. You slam the door shut. Was that a naked boy in the monster's arms? But you have no intention of opening that red door again.

You go back to the table and pick up the little bottle again. The walls of the room have a strange rubbery quality about them. Everything seems to be moving slightly - the walls, the floor, the ceiling, the table. If this is hip, you think, then I do not want to be hip. I better sip again so I can return to normal.

As the liquid goes down your throat, an alarm bell goes off in your mind. Wait! Is that what the label said? "Sip twice be nice..." No! It didn't say that. It said there would be a price to pay! As you slump to the floor your mind is thinking "Oh nooooo......."
1441.title: One Sip

14411.content:
That second sip was a big mistake.

You fall to the floor, writhing like a caterpillar being burned by some evil little boy with a magnifying glass. You look up and see the evil little boy, naked of course, holding his giant magnifying glass over you. Your nose fills with the stench of your burning fuzz.

Fuzz? You look at the horror you have become - a soft pulpy worm covered in green fuzz with long black hairs protruding from your head and tail. The hairs are barbed and you instinctively know they are poisonous. You manage to flick one into the giant hand of the naked little boy and he drops the magnifying glass, screaming "Mommy! Mommy! It bit me!"

The magnifying glass shatters on the floor into a thousand shards of glass that sparkle like ice and melt and run together on the floor to form a clear puddle that rises up into the shape of a crystal man, a naked crystal man. He walks toward you, tinkling (the sound, not the activity) like a crystal chandelier and you wish you were not so soft and squishy so that you could shatter him.

Your soft body straightens out and becomes a hard cylinder of stone. You could shatter the crystal man now, but you can't move your rigid body. "Articulation!" you scream. "Segments, plates, anything so I can move!"

Ominous cracking noises resonate through your rigid body and you feel yourself break apart into a dozen pieces of stone strung like a necklace on a rope big enough to moor a battleship. "Thank God I can move!"

You launch a viscious tail whip at the crystal man which shatters him into a thousand pieces of crystal that sparkle on the floor like ice and then melt and run together into a puddle that rises up into a new crystal man.

"Oh nooooo..... "
14411.title: Two sips

145.content: You pick up an object that you don't recognize. What is it? It seems to change and mutate as you hold it in your hands. The odd thought comes into your mind that it can be whatever you imagine it to be.
145.title: Your Turn

choices: You use the mysterious object to hide.
1451.content:
Your stomach grumbles. And you realized you haven't had any meal yet. You think of delicious roasted chicken. And the mysterious object transforms into one. You start tasting it, but drop the idea. Who knows? It might be poisonous.

But it would be useful to keep it. You put it in your pocket.

Suddenly, there is heavy knocking on the door. Your heart beats faster in response.
1451.title: The Intruder

14512.content:
Thinking very quickly, you imagine the mysterious object into the shape of a stuffed moose, but a hollow one that you can climb into and hide.

But no, that would be too obvious. Several ideas run through your mind as the knocking on the door gets more insistent. Create a gun? A rocket backpack? A suit of invisible clothes? A super-strong robot helper? A barrier that will stop bullets?

Your head is spinning. Maybe you should just open the door/? But no. That's exactly what the knocker wants you to do. You would be playing right into his hands.
14512.title: Think Fast

choices: You feel for a hidden button
You kick it as hard as you can
You sit and stare at it with deep concentration
15.content: You notice a hairline crack in the wall. You look closely and you feel sure it is some kind of secret door, but how to open it?
15.title: Secret panel

151.content:
Sure enough, you find a tiny little red button. There is something scratched into the wall next to it. "Do not push." You are surprised. This is the first writing that you have been able to read. Has someone been here before you?

You wonder if you should take the warning seriously. Maybe you should try some other way to open the secret panel?
151.title: Hidden button

choices: Enter shaft and try to crawl up the shaft
1511.content: There is a "click" and the panel slides open. It reveals a shaft that runs vertically. You lean your head in and can see neither top nor bottom. You could climb in and try to climb up or down, but the walls of the shaft are very smooth. It would probably be better to go back and try some other way to open the panel. After all, you were warned not to push that red button.
1511.title: Panel opens

15111.content:
You are very stubborn, aren't you? Despite all warnings, you crawl into a vertical shaft with smooth walls and then you attempt to climb up it.

You brace your back against one wall of the shaft, by putting pressure with your legs against the opposite wall, and begin inching your way up. It's tough going and you are thinking maybe there is an easier way. Of course there is an easier way! Your own stubborness is the reason you are in this tunnel struggling upwards an inch at the time.
15111.title: Crawl up shaft

151111.content:
Wedged between four walls, you pause. There were other doors, you think, sheer confusion washing all the fear from your mind. I should have gone through one of those

         You look up, hoping to see some end to the vent, and see none. Looking down between your legs, you are met with the same dismal blackness. Then you feel your legs, slick with sweat, begin to slip. Great. Your mind begins to race. The lip of the panel entrance is still within reach, but you are still determined to climb into the void above...
151111.title: Ascension?

choices: Try to climb back out into the chute
1511111.content:
A brief thought flits across your mind...a thought of turning back. But somehow, that just doesn't sound very appealing.
Yet, the problem remains. You feel yourself slipping... Only a few more seconds and you will be hurtling down into inky, unknown blackness.
This can't be the end already! you think to yourself.
In desperate frustration, you slam your feet against the wall.
To your surprise, the wall gives in and you find yourself tumbling out of the endless chute. You fall midair for a moment before landing with a bump upon hard, cold stone. All is dark.
From within the shadows, a timid, voice speaks, "H-h-hello?" It's a girl's voice.
1511111.title: The Dark Room

choices: This girl is crazy...try to climb out of the chute
15111112.content:
"Hello?" you speak. "Who are you?"
"Milligan," the girl whispers. "Who are you?"
"I'm...I'm..." you realize you can't remember. "I'm not sure..."
"Well, what should I call you, then?" she asks, her voice gaining strength. "Am I just supposed to say,'hey you'? No? We'll have to make up a name for you, then. Which do you like best...Sam, Lewis, John-though i suggest you don't pick that one. I've had some bad experiences with guys named John."
"Um...I'm not sure," you answer to the voice in the dark.
"How about Harry, then? Or Ishmael, Robin, Chris..."
"Um..."
"Ok, well if you aren't going to be any help, I will have to name you myself. I choose Zip."
"Zip?" even without your memory, you know that this name doesn't sound to inviting.
"Yes, Zip. It was the name of my old, faithful dog. I don't know if you are quite worthy of it. But since you are here to save me, you must be. Though I happen to know that many heros aren't that great. I've met a lot of them. They're usually stuck-up and not nearly as great as they are supposed to be..."
15111112.title: The Naming

151111122.content:
"So," you say, "Is there anyway to get some light in here?"
"Oh, yea," Milligan answers. "Sorry...there are a few matches and a candle in the corner, I think. It went out when you fell through."
"I don't know where the corner is...so could you do it?"
"Not really. Just start crawling. You're sure to find the corner eventually."
With a sigh of exasperation, you take a few timid steps. Almost immediately, your head meets stone with a deafening crack, and you fall to the ground in a daze.
"Ouch..." Milligan says simpathetically.
You feel around the dusty, stone ground until your fingers fall upon something waxy-the candle-and momentarily the matches.
Striking a match against the wall, a flame springs up, sending a warm glow creeping up the cold walls. You quickly light the candle and raise it, turning to meet Milligan.
And then, you realize for the first time why the girl wasn't able to light the candle herself.
Her slim form was hunched, and her arms pulled back ruthlessly, tied to a steel poll in the center of the room. She wore a coarse jacket and a long, dark skirt. Her knees were pulled up to her chin, and her forehead was rested upon it. As the candlelight fell upon her, she swung back long dark hair to reveal piercing gray eyes.
151111122.title: Milligan

151112.content:
"This is nuts!", you say out loud in a mild state of dismay at your own unnecessarily drastic actions.

Climbing back down and into the tunnel you'd arrived at the vertical shaft from, you decide to try another corridor leading anywhere away from here.
151112.title: Something Else

152.content:
You jump up and down as hard as you can.

Suddenly there is a "click" and the panel slides open revealing a small space only 3feet by 3feet by 3feet. There are two buttons at the back, one with an "up" arrow and one with a "down" arrow. You crawl inside the little cubicle. It must be some kind of elevator.
152.title: Jump up and down

1521.content:
The little elevator accelerates smoothly. After a while, it decelerates and comes to a stop. A side panel snaps open so suddenly you flinch. Then you step out into a room filled with light.

You squint until your eyes can adjust to all this brightness. Every surface of the room - the walls, the floor, the ceiling - is glowing with a white light. Suddenly there is a wrenching displacement in your your body as though you just fell a short distance and then a reflexive convulsion of your spine that makes your shoulders jump. What's happening to you? The light in the room rises in intensity so rapidly that you shut your eyes. Your ears "pop" as the air pressure suddenly changes.

You open your eyes. You are in a different room now. A room that seems open to space on one side. You see a blackness sprinkled with the intense pinpoint lights of stars and there is something else... a large green and brown planet.

You are fascinated by this view of space, but you turn around when you hear a door slide open behind you.

"Welcome, to Triforce Station" says a woman in a blue uniform. "May I help you?"

At first you are speechless, but the woman just stands there looking at you, so you manage to say "Y-yes..."

The woman says "How may I help you?"

"I don't know..." you say.

The woman smiles and says "Are you unacquainted with humbots?"

"I guess so..." you say.
1521.title: Going up

15211.content:
"Humbots are humanoid robots. I am a humbot. I can understand your questions, so please feel free to ask me anything. If I don't understand you, then I will ask for clarification. May I help you?"

A robot? She looks very much like a real woman to you, but you decide to believe her. Whether she is a real human or a robot, at least she will answer your questions.

YOU SAY "What is this place?"

HUMBOT "This is Triforce Station, the central observation platform for the Sisyski Delegation to Planet 337. That's the planet you see in the viewscreen behind you. Do you need more information?"

YOU SAY "Why did you bring me here?"

HUMBOT "I did not bring you here. You entered one of our transmatters, apparently of your own free will. May I help you?"

YOU SAY "I didn't know what it was. What is the Sisyski Delegation?"

HUMBOT "Sisyski is the Local Name for Planet 156. They are very active in space exploration and have sent many delegations to newly discovered worlds. Do you need more information?"
15211.title: Humbots

152111.content:
HUMBOT "May I help you?"

YOU SAY "Why did this Sisyski Delegation come to Planet 337?"

HUMBOT "I am sorry, but that information is classified. May I help you?"

YOU SAY "Do you know who I am?"

HUMBOT "Your retinal scan does not match anyone in the database. There is a match on your facial features. Do you need more information?"

YOU SAY "Yes. If there is a match, then who am I?"

HUMBOT "I am sorry, but that information is classified? May I help you?"

YOU SAY "WHY is it classified?"

HUMBOT "I am sorry, but that information is classified. May I help you?"

YOU SAY "You are not being very helpful. Tell me more about Planet 337."

HUMBOT "Planet 337 has the Local Name of Nevermore. Nevermore was awarded to the League of True Planets when they achieved victory in the Century Wars. The name is symbolic of the peace declaration that ended that conflict. Nevermore is a warm planet with a population composed primarily of three different intelligent races - the humans, the Tsiuni, and the Verdites. Do you need more information?"

YOU SAY "Can you tell me what I should do next?"

HUMBOT "I don't understand your question. You are an autonomous being. I have no way of knowing what you should do next. Do you need more information?"

YOU SAY "How do I get back to the surface of Nevermore?"

HUMBOT "Transmat stations are located at the hallway intersections. They are marked with this symbol. Do you need more information?"

A symbol forms in the air, apparently a holographic projection produced by the Humbot. It is a red "T" enclosed in a green circle.

YOU SAY "No. Thanks for your help."

The humbot walks away slowly. looking for someone else to help. You run to the nearest hallway intersection and locate the red T in a green circle. There is a small platform to step on, but nothing happens. You forgot to ask her how to activate it. But it starts beeping slowly and you figure it's set up to work automatically. The beeping speeds up until there is an abrupt shift in your surroundings. You are standing in another hallway somewhere.

But you have no idea where.
152111.title: Humbot (2)

1522.content:
The elevator drops and your stomach feels queasy, but the ride is a smooth one.

Then it becomes not so smooth as the elevator rattles and creaks and groans to a stop and the door slides open with a rusty squeal.

The room before you has walls of rough-cut stone. There is a table and a chair. They look handmade and very heavy. Standing by the huge fireplace that fills one wall is a huge man, a man who looks very strong and is staring hard at you.

You feel anxious, but he breaks into a grin and says "Welcome to Sublevel One! I am Barl the Fitter"
1522.title: Going down

15221.content:
"What is this place?" you manage to ask.

Barl has a friendly grin. "Sublevel One? It's my little welcome center for new visitors."

"This is your house?"

"No, I work here. My home is on the surface. Do I look like a dwarf who would live in a cave?" And he laughs.

You laugh, too. "No, you would be a pretty big dwarf!"

"You will need some equipment if you want to go on. You do want to go on, don't you?"

"I don't know," you say. "I don't know what it's all about. It feels dangerous."

Barl laughs. "Don't be afraid! You won't be harmed on Sublevel One! Later? Maybe..." And he winks at you.

You don't feel very reassured, so you ask, "But what's it all about? I don't get it."

He laughs again. "Of course you don't get it yet. You're on the outside looking in. Let's get you equipped and into the game and then you'll feel more at home."

"So it's a game?" you ask.

"Don't jump to conclusions!" Barl says with a grin. "Don't make up your mind until you get into it."
15221.title: Sublevel One

152211.content:
He opens the doors of a huge wooden wardrobe that completely covers one wall of the room. Inside are an assortment of weapons - swords and shields, axes and knives, lances and shields, mysterious rods, spheres of metal and crystal, scrolls and books, and things so odd you don't even have words for them.

"I don't know how to use any of this stuff," you tell the big man.

"Not even this?" he says, holding up a book.

"Well, I can read if that's what you mean, but I don't know how to swordfight or use these weapons."

He puts his fingers to his chin and looks you over. "Hmmm... Perhaps it's your mind that will have to be your weapon." He holds up his hand when he sees you are about to protest again. "Let's not call it a 'weapon' - let's call it a 'tool'. Do you find that word more comfortable?"

"My mind is a tool? I guess so. That's more the way I think of it myself. 'Weapon' sounds so... mean... and hostile."

Barl laughs. "And you are a "gentleman", eh? Hahaha! Not for you to slice off a man's head with a mighty swing of your sword? Hahaha!"

Your face turns red as you hear him ridicule you and, surprisingly, you feel a surge of anger well up in you.

Barl stops laughing and looks at you seriously. "I thought so," he says without smiling. He stares at you in a way that makes you feel that he could strike you down with one blow of his big fist. Your anger drains away and is replaced by fear. You feel your knees trembling a little.

Barl smiles again and puts his arm around your shoulder. "You have much to learn, my "hot-and-cold" friend," and he laughs at his little joke.

You don't see the joke, but you try to laugh a little bit. It seems the safest thing to do when an insane killer giant has his arm around your shoulders.
152211.title: The Fitting Room

1522111.content:
Barl the Outfitter stands back and looks you up and down.

"I think it will be leather for you," he says and hands you a sharp looking leather vest. It's a deep brown, polished to a high sheen, and embossed with brass studs. It fits well and you immediately feel more powerful.

"How does it feel?" Barl asks.

"Great!"

Barl laughs. "Wear it always. It will keep you strong."

"Magic?"

"Magic is a word to describe things we don't understand. To some this vest would be advanced technology. Perhaps to you it is magic."

Whatever it is, you enjoy the feel and smell of it. It will be no problem to "wear it always".

Barl puts a finger to his chin. "You need a name... It will be Hac Mindtool."

"Hac Mindtool? What kind of name is that?"

"It's the kind of name that I have named you and since I am Barl the Outfitter, giver of names, it is the name by which you will be known."

"Fine..." you say, not wanting him to get violent. He's a nice guy, but also a bit of a bully.

"Now..." says Barl. "You must begin your first mission. I want you to find out whatever you can about the Tsiuni."

"Who are the Tsiuni?"

Barl winks. "That is your mission. And there is the way to it." He points at a very small door set into the back wall.

"That looks like a door for dwarves," you say.

"It is," says Barl. "But you have my permission to use it. Come back as soon as you know who the Tsiuni are. Good-bye."

He opens the door for you and you shrug and crawl through.
1522111.title: The Vest

15221111.content:
The door opens onto a narrow tunnel that runs a few meters before it widens into a large cave. Sunlight at the opposite end of the cave indicates an exit. You pause for a moment to collect your thoughts.

Hac Mindtool is a stupid name... Hac... It sounds like you got a husk caught in your throat... Oh well...

You head for the sunlight and soon find yourself in a small valley. It looks desolate with only some scrubby brush and a few small trees. Not far away are wagon tracks in the sand. You follow them.

The tracks lead to a weathered cabin with a wagon parked near it. Attached to the wagon is an odd beast with striped fur and huge hooves. It might not be wise to approach the cabin, so you find a comfortable hiding spot in the tall brush where you can observe the cabin without being seen.

Eventually the door of the cabin opens and someone comes out. The "someone" is not human. It has a human shape, but its skin is reptilian and covered in a black and white pattern of swirls and dots. It has a strangely shaped head with a short snout and eyes set far to the side. The eyes can swivel, looking forward or back.

"That must be a Tsiuni," you think.

The Tsiuni climbs into the wagon, flicks the reins, and the wagon moves off down the road. You hear the creaking of the wheels, the clopping of the hooves, the snorts of the beast, but it finally fades away to a heavy silence. The cabin seems deserted.

You approach cautiously and knock on the door. No answer. You push open the door and enter the cabin.
15221111.title: The Cabin

152211111.content:
Inside the cabin the walls look like yellow plastic. You walk back out on the porch. Yes, it just looks like an old weather-beaten wood cabin from the outside. But inside, it's all slick, glossy, and yellow.

There is no furniture, but part of the wall extends out to function as a table and bench. It has a molded look that reminds you of plastic toys. There seem to be none of the small items you would expect - no dishes, books, clothes, lamps, pots, pans - none of the many objects that daily life requires. It dawns on you that this "cabin" is not for living in. Exactly what its function might be is difficult to imagine.

You go back outside and contemplate your next step. Your mission was just to find out something about the Tsiuni and you have done that, haven't you? You know what they look like and you have been in one of their structures. Maybe you should follow the wagon tracks and find out a little more?

A humming overhead attracts your attention. There is a glass bubble slowly descending. It lands near the porch and you see that there is a man sitting inside it at a control panel. A hole forms in the side of the transparent bubble and he steps out.

He shows you a small card and asks "Are you authorized to be here?"

You struggle to read the card. The print is too small, but you see that it has the man's picture on it. How should you answer? Well, technically Barl the Outfitter authorized you, so you say "Yes. I am."
152211111.title: Glass Bubble

154.content: You kick the panel as hard as you can. There is a tremendous explosion. It would have sounded like KABOOOMMM if you had lived long enough to hear all of it. But you just hear KA_
154.title: Kick It

155.content:
Do you have psychokinetic powers? Are you going to open a secret panel with your mind?

Are you so completely passive that your first course of action when faced with a problem is to sit and stare at it?

Actually, you think, that's not a bad thing to do if you are not pressed for time. Don't rush in to solve a problem. Look it over first. Turn it around in your mind and consider it from all angles. You may see a solution that is quicker and easier than the one you would have first attempted.

But after sitting and staring at the panel for awhile, you realize that you will have to back up and try something else.
155.title: Stare at the panel
